alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Chattooga; Floyd; Gordon; Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Floyd, western Gordon, northwestern Polk, Chattooga and northwestern Bartow Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 349 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Chesterfield to Chattoogaville, and moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Rome, Summerville, Adairsville, Trion, Cave Spring, Plainville, Shannon, Lyerly, Menlo, Pinson, Lindale, Oostanaula, Subligna, Tidings, Armuchee, Lake Marvin, Coosa, Cloudland, Berryton, and Chattoogaville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northwestern Georgia.
